channel.title: elizaOS Daily Intelligence
channel.description: Daily facts and insights from the elizaOS ecosystem

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-31
item.description:
Summary: The ElizaOS ecosystem is balancing critical technical stabilization, including fixes for project generation and v2.0 development, against significant community concerns regarding token migration eligibility and financial runway. Strategic integration with the Moltbot/openclaw network is being explored to expand the agent ecosystem into mobile and voice interfaces.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • Can not generate project (closed)
  • Integrate N8N Workflow Engine (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #partners: Discussions focused on the 8-month financial runway and the trade-offs between decentralized sovereignty and centralized AI infrastructure security....
  • #coders: Technical comparison between ElizaOS (multi-agent) and Clawdbot (assistant). Discussion on Moltbook integration and mobile/voice interface gaps in Eliza....
  • #discussion: Dominated by migration troubleshooting and high-alert security warnings following a user hack. Updates on Jeju staking mechanics using ETH placeholders....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-29
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS has pivoted strongly toward a multi-product strategy and workflow automation platform, integrating n8n as a core engine for AI agent tasks. Technical efforts are concurrently focused on resolving persistent OpenRouter embedding issues and stabilizing the v2.0.0 scoped CLI release.

GitHub Activity:

  • fix: update import statement in elizaos.js to use package alias (merged)
  • [Plugin] Integrate N8N Workflow Engine (open)
  • V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #-partners: Serious legal and structural concerns were raised regarding the 'ClawdBot' FOMO dapp, characterizing it as a potential scam/illegal gambling operation. Discussions shifted to improving the @elizaos Tw...
  • #-coders: Troubleshooting centered on OpenRouter embedding failures, MIME_TYPE_MISMATCH errors in SSE streaming (with socket.io recommended as a fix), and the use of 'Composer 1' over Cursor's AUTO mode for dep...
  • core-devs: Development roadmap focused on developer onboarding (Time To Value), n8n workflow integration, and the implementation of MCP for repo activity data....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-28
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS has initiated a major technical pivot toward a workflow-automation platform integrated with n8n, while simultaneously releasing Eliza v2.0.0 to the npm 'next' tag. Development focus is shifting from hardware to a multi-product strategy including Babylon, Hyperscape, and Eliza Anime to reward long-term holders.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (open)
  • fix(v2.0.0): Python example testing & fixes (merged)
  • Can not generate project (closed)

Community Highlights:

  • #core-devs: Strategic pivot from hardware development to an AI agent platform focused on n8n workflow automation for non-technical users....
  • #coders: Resolution of Knowledge plugin cost issues and configuration errors related to 'openrouter' embedding providers....
  • #discussion: Ongoing talks regarding the Babylon airdrop for ElizaOS holders and mapping human decision patterns to trading agent logic....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-27
item.description:
Summary: Core developers returned from medical leave as the project shifted focus toward infrastructure stability and plugin integration for Eliza V2.0.0. Simultaneously, significant community tension persisted regarding the launch of ecosystem tokens and $ELIZAOS token price performance.

GitHub Activity:

  • fix: update import statement in elizaos.js to use package alias (merged)
  • V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (open)
  • Opus - pro and Ultra - sonnet? Is this right? (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #partners: Exploration of integrating Eliza into the Seeker phone DApp store as a premiere AI assistant using a Claude-bot style interface....
  • #coders: Technical troubleshooting of plugin callback behaviors and investigation into the recovery of 481K lines of unreleased code found in old branches....
  • #discussion: Heated debate over the $ELIZAOS token reaching all-time lows and community backlash regarding 'gold' token launches for ecosystem projects like Hyperscape....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-25
item.description:
Summary: The project is navigating significant internal tension regarding ecosystem tokenomics and funding for independent projects like Hyperscape, while simultaneously advancing technical foundations for Eliza V2.0.0 and DaVinci Resolve AI integration. Core leadership is balancing resource constraints and a 20 million market cap against community demands for more direct $elizaos token utility.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (open)
  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #partners: Critical debate regarding 'GOLD' token launch for Hyperscape. Core team cites 8-month runway and budget constraints as reason for separate funding, while partners argue it dilutes $elizaos value....
  • #coders: Focus on DaVinci Resolve MCP integration and resolving CLI migration errors during the 1.6.5 to 1.7.2 transition....
  • #discussion: Dominated by scam alerts regarding fake ai16z-to-elizaOS migrations and speculation on ecosystem token distributions....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-24
item.description:
Summary: The discord community is heavily focused on the controversial GOLD token launch and insider trading allegations, while technical development shifts toward the elizaOS V2.0.0 dynamic execution engine and new plugin integrations.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (open)
  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)
  • Eligibility Mismatch & Snapshot Bug - Tangem Hardware Wallet (closed)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Focused on GOLD token controversy, specifically allegations of insider trading and a 40% dev wallet. Community expressed frustration over project prioritization and monetization transparency....
  • #coders: Resolution of Discord plugin v1.3.8 issues and the release of the Sportradar integration. Discussion on building prediction agents similar to Polymarket using multi-AI competition models....
  • #partners: Strategic discussions regarding tax-efficient airdrop mechanisms using buy-and-burn smart contracts and the sunset timeline for Hyperfy legacy hosting....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-20
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS released version 1.7.2 focusing on stability and streaming reliability, while core development shifted toward a Rust-based v2.0.0 and WASM compatibility. Community discussions centered on AI-powered moderation systems and market liquidity cycles.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)
  • dashboard usability bug: clicking outside input box (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Community discussed Quantitative Easing cycles and their positive historical impact on crypto microcaps, alongside concerns over long-term token sustainability....
  • #coders: Demonstration of 'Solimp', an Eliza-based Telegram moderation bot using exponential mutes to manage spam. Discussion also covered the 'jintern' revival and development of RAG systems using the knowled...
  • #core-devs: Technical review of PR #6286 focused on refining 'ensureEntities' logic into batch processing rather than individual calls to optimize runtime performance....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-19
item.description:
Summary: Core development remains focused on the v2.0.0 Rust/TypeScript transition and significant database refactoring, while the community faces anxiety regarding token utility, budget constraints, and price manipulation.

GitHub Activity:

  • refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter (merged)
  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)
  • Reflection evaluator fails with 'Entity not found' (closed)

Community Highlights:

  • #core-devs: Initiative launched to optimize technical documentation specifically for AI agent consumption using kapa.ai's best practices....
  • #discussion: Deep concerns regarding token performance and utility; debate on the future of AI-integrated prediction markets....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-18
item.description:
Summary: Development shifted towards ElizaOS v2.0.0 with significant infrastructure refactoring, alongside the successful implementation of Eliza on the Internet Computer Protocol (ICP). Community attention is currently focused on the February 4th token migration deadline and technical hurdles in prediction market integrations.

GitHub Activity:

  • refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter (merged)
  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • USE_OPENAI_EMBEDDING setting not respected (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Debates on the validity of AI prediction markets and proposals for holder rewards tied to agent creation....
  • #coders: Technical deep dive into high-performance trading systems using Rust and NATS Jetstream; troubleshooting Cloudflare 403 blocks on Polymarket CLOB APIs....
  • #partners: Discussion of the Jeju decentralized compute network and its potential use for asynchronous autonomous agents....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-17
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS development has reached a stable milestone with significant performance optimizations in runtime initialization and the refactoring of core database adapters. However, the project faces critical community challenges including token price manipulation by whales and a sophisticated GitHub repository spoofing incident involving manipulated Git commits.

GitHub Activity:

  • refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter (merged)
  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)
  • Reflection evaluator fails with 'Entity not found' - UPDATE_CONTACT requires entity initialization (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Intense discussion on token economics, whale manipulation ($2M sell-off), and the verification of Git commits via PGP signatures following repo spoofing....
  • #coders: Deep dive into high-performance Solana infrastructure including gRPC streaming and Jito's ShredStream; clarification that automated trading on Polymarket is officially supported....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-16
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS is prioritizing architectural simplification in version 2.0.0 and cloud refinement while managing a critical token migration deadline on February 4th. Development highlights include the release of a Polymarket trading plugin and significant core performance optimizations in agent initialization.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • refactor(plugin-sql): extract domain stores from BaseDrizzleAdapter (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Dominance of token migration support for users encountering Phantom and Trust wallet errors; community concern regarding significant market price decline....
  • #coders: Technical deep dive into Polymarket API legitimacy, Socket.IO server access patterns for custom plugins, and Together.ai inference integration....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-14
item.description:
Summary: The core development team has pivoted focus to ElizaCloud improvements, de-prioritizing v2.0.0 work. Significant technical progress was made in multi-step workflows while the project addressed critical OAuth infrastructure planning and GitHub Action authentication failures.

GitHub Activity:

  • feat(v2.0.0): wasm agent runtime (open)
  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • Messaging API - Fix double processing & align transports (closed)

Community Highlights:

  • core-devs: Focus has shifted to ElizaCloud improvements including credit top-up idempotency fixes and test architecture review. Authentication issues with GitHub OIDC persist....
  • coders: Discussions on Recursive Language Models (RLMs) for extended context and detailed instructions for monorepo knowledge uploads involving cli linking....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-13
item.description:
Summary: ElizaOS development focused on critical ElizaCloud app creator debugging and core performance optimizations, while community discussions centered on token value tied to the upcoming Jeju network. Infrastructure stability was addressed by resolving expired API keys in CI/CD pipelines.

GitHub Activity:

  • feat: add plugin-blockrun for x402 micropayments (open)
  • feat: unified hooks with multi-transport support (merged)
  • feat(plugin-sql): add CachedDatabaseAdapter with LRU caching (draft)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Extensive debate on token value; DorianD argued value is organic and depends on the Jeju network operationalizing gas fees for agents rather than VC-backed pumps....
  • #coders: Technical deep-dive on ElizaCloud app creator bugs including file visibility intermittently failing and git state corruption from manual AI agent commands....
  • #core-devs: Resolved expired Anthropic API keys in CI; discussed Rust runtime for performance, concluding Bun provides similar speed with lower overhead for current bottleneck areas....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-12
item.description:
Summary: Initial intelligence indicates significant performance benchmarks for ElizaOS, with core runtime initialization speed increased by up to 40%. Concurrently, development is pivoting toward decentralized infrastructure with the Jeju layer and a transition to Eliza 2.0 multi-language support.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • optimize runtime initialization (merged)
  • add plugin-blockrun for x402 micropayments (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #core-devs: Demonstration of 3D model/avatar generation with low poly mode; clarification that agent design uses separate human simulator components rather than subagents....
  • #discussion: Debates regarding crypto adoption timelines (50+ years) and strategies for separating political content from project social media accounts....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-11
item.description:
Summary: The ecosystem is currently transitioning toward Eliza 2.0 and the Jeju Layer 2 launch, focusing on multi-language support and LLM-free agent architectures. While technical progress in gaming automation and cloud infrastructure is robust, the project faces significant headwinds from Korean exchange delistings and community debate over token utility.

GitHub Activity:

  • feat: add plugin-blockrun for x402 micropayments (open)
  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • docs: core documentation guides (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #discussion: Focus on the launch of Jeju layer and branding debates regarding 'Eliza Open Systems.' Significant concerns were raised about token price pressure due to contributor minting without active gas utility...
  • #core-devs: Showcasing of Rust implementations and LLM-free architectures. Stan and Shaw collaborated on MMO automation techniques, including evading bot detection in WoW using pixel encoding....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2026-01-10
item.description:
Summary: The ElizaOS ecosystem is undergoing a major architectural shift with the proposal of Eliza 2.0 while facing a regulatory crisis in South Korea as exchanges delist tokens. Development focus remains on cross-platform skill interoperability, cloud infrastructure billing, and the introduction of an MMORPG-style character progression system for the leaderboard.

GitHub Activity:

  • V2.0.0 (open)
  • MMORPG-style character system to leaderboard API (merged)

Community Highlights:

  • #core-devs: Discussions focused on Eliza 2.0 redesign and an experiment to convert plugins into deterministic 'skills' for cross-platform compatibility....
  • #discussion: Contextualized the name 'JEJU' as a tech testing ground in Korea and explored AI applications for monitoring dopamine levels....
